shot.composition: POV racing through an artery, suddenly encountering a massive White Blood Cell (Macrophage) patrolling the bloodstream. 16:9.
shot.lens: Wide-angle macro lens (12mm equivalent) to emphasize the immense scale difference between the RBC and the Macrophage.
shot.camera_movement: Fast tracking shot that suddenly slows and banks hard, using a red blood cell for cover, orbiting the massive White Cell.

subject.description: A giant, amorphous Macrophage, translucent with visible internal structures (nucleus, granules). It moves slowly and purposefully, extending pseudopods. Red blood cells rush past like small cars next to a tank.
subject.props: Cellular debris or bacteria (glowing green particles) being actively engulfed by the Macrophage.

scene.environment: Flowing plasma tunnel, textured vessel walls. The flow is diverted by the presence of the large cell.

visual_details.action: A tense near-miss scenario. The camera hides and evades as the Macrophage patrols the area, emphasizing its role as a guardian of the bloodstream.
visual_details.special_effects: Subsurface scattering on the Macrophage making it look realistic and alive, realistic membrane dynamics, fluid displacement waves.
visual_details.negative_prompt_video: Simple shapes, smooth surfaces, blurry details, slow movement, artifacts, black and white, grey tones, minimalism, friendly atmosphere, flat lighting.

cinematography.lighting: Dramatic backlighting on the Macrophage, making it glow ominously. Warm red ambient light from the surrounding blood.
cinematography.color_palette: Translucent whites, pale yellows, and golds (Macrophage), deep crimson (blood).

audio.music: Suspenseful, low-frequency electronic score with a slow, pulsing rhythm (Johann Johannsson style). Atonal elements when the Macrophage is close.
audio.sound_effects: A low, pulsating energy rumble associated with the Macrophage movement, subtle stretching sounds of pseudopods, gelatinous engulfing sounds.
